dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (0.S./CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What kind of man are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA is raging at him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: She is all I have to cling to! She is my sole comfort in our marriage. The DUKE patiently hears her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BESS's eyes are filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have robbed me of my only friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA pauses, nearly spent. Then she finally challeng the DUKE, more imploring than angry.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: What is wrong with me? Why have you never loved me?!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (simple, exhausted clarity) I do not claim to be a man of fine sensibility, G, but I have always known what I expect from this marriage and what I am prepared to give. GEORGIANA doesn’t reply.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As a husband, I have fulfilled my obligations. As a wife, you have not.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: She has to go! Now! She is never to set foot in this house again!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (Hackles rising) Do mind your temper, G. You are quite forgetting yourself.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I want her out! I never want to lay eyes on her again! Go down and tell her to leave at once!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I couldn't ask her that. I won't do it, G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open - BESS jumps aside - and GEORGIANA comes crashing out of the sitting room, furious. GEORGIAN storms down the hall, followed by BESS.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: Georgiana--!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: You have taken yourself from me! You don't love me!

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: I do love you. Really I do.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: No! Love is an act! It is more than words and undying oaths! It's what you do! I loved you! You only said you did. BESS is stung. Her eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Leave. Get out of this house! BESS remains standing, reaches out for GEORGIANA.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (breaks down, cries out) Get out!!! BESS leaves the room. GEORGIANA sinks slowly to the floor weeping, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA sits, like a little girl, back at home. LADY SPENCER pours tea from a silver Samovar.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: I did not like her from the first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made that quite clear, Mama.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: She is gone from Devonshire House, I hope. GEORGIANA looks away, ashamed. LADY SPENCER puts the Samovar down.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're living there together? Georgiana, what have you permitted to happen?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I don’t know! Won't you please just help me! Tell me what to do, Mama! GEORGIANA hangs her head. LADY SPENCER surveys her daught and the mess she's in. Her demeanor softens.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: You must write to your husband and insist he send her back to whatever horrid little place she came from.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: He will not. It is out of the question, he says.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: Then you must return and resume your duties. Make him realize whom he loves. You will give up your politics, your nights on the town, your gambling. For once you will devote yourself as a loving wife and settle down to the task at hand: providing him with an heir. And then he will soon tire of her. GEORGIANA looks at her mother with sadness.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have no other option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen from inside the house, GEORGIANA gets out of her carriage, observed by a couple of servants. She proceeds to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DUKE awaits her just inside the door. He looks at her with worry.

dialogues.speaker: THE DUKE
dialogues.text: Hello, G. ...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (Coldly) William. GEORGIANA walks straight past him and proceeds upstairs. At the top BESS meets her with an apologetic demeanour. GEORGIANA is cold as ice. She passes her without even a look.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 86
dialogues.text: INT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE - GEORGIANA’S BEDROOM - LATER 87 BESS quietly enters GEORGIANA's room.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I may not have the authority to remove you from this house, but I can at least order you out of my room.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: Won't you please let me explain? GEORGIANA becomes furious and shouts at BESS.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: There is nothing to explain. I trusted you, I made you my confidante, and you repaid me by stealing what is mine. GEORGIANA turns her back and looks out of the window. BES approaches her carefully.  88

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: This is my only chance of ever seeing my children again. The Duke is the most powerful peer in England. He is my only chance. GEORGIANA turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: There are limits to the sacrifices one makes to see one's children.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: No, there aren't. No limits whatsoever. GEORGIANA takes in what she just said, before letting animosity get the better of her once again and turning aw

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Get out of here. We have nothing more to say to one another. BESS leaves, closing the door silently behind her. GEORGIANA’s finger slowly pushes a perfume bottle off her dressing table until it falls and smashes on the floor. GEORGIANA hears the sound of carriages approaching. She gets up and goes to the window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DUKE's CARRIAGE pulls up. AUGUSTUS, JOHN, and HARRY emerge from the carriage. BESS shrieks with joy and leaps out of the house. She run and hugs them, crying. It’s incredibly touching and GEORG is moved, despite herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA comes downstairs. Unseen, she looks into the ro and watches the DUKE getting AUGUSTUS a hunting rifle fro the wall. The DUKE appears surprisingly keen, gentle even He clearly relates to boys. To one side BESS holds a sleeping HARRY. GEORGIANA stares on in silence, understanding the DUKE an BESS in a way she has never done before. They look like a quiet, functional family unit. GEORGIANA quietly comes closer. The DUKE is now showing AUGUSTUS how to use the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: .---hold it like that, Augustus, it won't come back at you.

dialogues.speaker: AUGUSTUS
dialogues.text: Yes, I see.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Good. Your father doesn't hunt, I take it.

dialogues.speaker: AUGUSTUS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Oh dear. Well, we can soon make up for that. AUGUSTUS smiles, as does BESS. The DUKE looks up, and see her approval does a rare thing: he smiles too. BESS gets and brings the DUKE a drink.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: (Whispered gently) Thank you. The DUKE strokes her hand. GEORGIANA moves away and leave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a grey and drizzly day. The gardens are largely empt GREY'S carriage is parked by the roadside. COACHMEN wait beside it, informally leaning on the vehicle. A little further down the road, GEORGIANA’s carriage pulls up. In wide shot GEORGIANA, black cape with hood up, makes he way across the gardens.  Well away from the carriages and COACHMEN, GEORGIANA approaches GREY, who is waiting under the trees. GEORGIAN seems preoccupied. GREY, however, is simply excited about them meeting again.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: (Hushed voice) Did you tell the Duke who you were meeting?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Did he ask?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: No. GREY pauses for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: He has other things on his mind. GREY stops and scrutinises GEORGIANA. He can tell that sh is not truly present.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: As do you. The direct recognition causes GEORGIANA to stop too, and then look away. She walks off in a different direction. GREY follows.

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Softer now) Would it help to unburden yourself? GEORGIANA sends him a little smile and a shake of the hea

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: It is nothing I can discuss with you. Besides, it would only bore.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You don't have to please others all the time.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I was brought up to. It's a difficult lesson to unlearn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you do it so that people will love you.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (looks deeply at him) What would make you think that?

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: From what I have seen. With your husband, your friends - especially Lady Bess. Even the public.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (looks away) I have never thought of it that way. You make me sound pitiable. GEORGIANA turns and walks away, upset. GREY realizes he h gone too far. He chases up with her.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I've gone beyond my brief. I apologize. Please believe it was only for your sake I spoke. GEORGIANA looks at him, and then carries on walking slowl thinking deeply. Grey moves closer to her again.

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please tell me what is wrong. She turns and looks at him intensely. The fountains in th pleasure garden dance in the background.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I fear I have done some things too late in life and some too early. They stare at each other a moment. The wind blows gently the leaves of the trees above them.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: No, you haven't. Slowly, GREY moves to GEORGIANA. The air is thick. GREY g closer. They kiss. Not for long, but a gentle, warm kiss. Then he withdraws. GEORGIANA is blushing.  91

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have waited all my life for that kiss. GEORGIANA averts her eyes, and looks confused. He loses h composure a bit.

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry ...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: No. It's... She looks up at him again.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have never been kissed like that before. They stand and look at each other. Then they move closer, another kiss. Gentle. And longer, this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA is with BESS and the DUKE. She seems sober, together and strong: fortified. They sit opposite each ot at the table as if in negotiation. A long silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: All right. Beat. The DUKE looks at BESS. What does she mean?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: "All right..?"

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Do you love each other?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Georgiana -

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Do you love Bess, Your Grace?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: +». Well ... I... where is all this leading?

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: I make no demands on him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: ...And Bess, you love my husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .».. As I do you. GEORGIANA nods, still not giving anything away.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: You intend to stay here?

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: -.. William asked that I do. GEORGIANA nods.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: And you couldn't find it in your heart to refuse him.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: -.-No. BESS and the DUKE remain quiet. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Then let us make a deal.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: A deal? Beat. The DUKE and BESS exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Yes. I give you my blessing if you will accept my feelings for Charles Grey. BESS blinks, taken aback. GEORGIANA is nervous. She smile waiting for The DUKE's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wasn't sure at first, I thought perhaps it was a dalliance or ... But it isn't. He can make me happy. BESS tries to manage a smile. She darts a look at the DUK who now stands. Suddenly cutlery and crystal jangle. BESS and GEORGIANA start.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (seething with fury) A deal! A deal!! I don't make deals! I'm in charge of it all!! I would call him out! I would challenge him! I would put a bullet in the upstart’s head--!  92 93

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: William--!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (to BESS) Be quiet! (to GEORGIANA) Are you determined to make me a total laughing stock? A man who cannot sire a son and then a cuckold?

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: William, Georgiana only asks what we ourselves —

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Be quiet, you fool! (to GEORGIANA) Are you his whore?!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: ... No... but I can't see why you should mind. You have Bess and three boys...

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Three boys??? Do you think I can make those bastards my heirs? Well, do you? GEORGIANA and BESS are frightened. GEORGIANA hurries out the room. A moment passes, then the DUKE strides out as w

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: William...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA walks fast through the space. She passes a FOOTMAN on the way to her bedroom. The DUKE charges after her. GEORGIANA quickens her pace. BESS follows behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA comes into her room, and slams the door behind A few moments later, the door opens. The DUKE enters. He shuts the door. He glares at GEORGIANA. She looks at him. DUKE asks a real question for once.  94 95 96 97 98

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You don't know me in the least, do you?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I do. We're a bad match.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I asked but two things when we wed: loyalty and a male heir.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Yes, same as your dogs. The DUKE's eyes flash. He snaps. He grabs her. She tries fight him off. Her dress is torn. They struggle. The DUKE overpowers her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BESS stands outside the door. We HEAR GEORGIANA SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DUKE pins GEORGIANA onto the bed and tears away at he clothes. We hear the RIP of silk and lace. GEORGIANA screams again. He holds her face tightly between his hand and stares coldly at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE G. and HARRYO stare at the door of their room as t screams continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FOOTMAN stands at attention, trying to remain impassive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BESS hovers at the door as she listens to the struggle an screams inside. She turns and sees CHARLOTTE standing a f feet away, staring at her. BESS moves away from the door, unable to stop what's going on inside.  99 100

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: (To Charlotte, softly) Come with me. CHARLOTTE stays rooted to the spot.

dialogues.speaker: BESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Firmer) Charlotte, come with me. BESS takes CHARLOTTE’S arm and hurries her off down the h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA lies on the bed. It's over. Her clothes are torn. Her face is red and wet with tears. The DUKE sits on the side of the bed, panting, used up.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Give me a son and then do what the hell you want, as long as you do it discreetly. Until then you stay here and do as I say. The DUKE gets up and leaves. GEORGIANA's expression is bl dead. The sounds of crowds cheering and clapping fade up the background until we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIDAN stands before A HUGE CROWD. There is bunting in WHIG colours and banners. The PRESS are out in even great numbers than before.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN
dialogues.text: I give you the winner! Mr Fox! The Man of the People! FOX comes forth to a ROAR of approval. He yells out:

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: And I give you the weapon! The Duchess of Devonshire! GEORGIANA, still shell-shocked, comes forth to WILD CHEER She succeeds in smiling to the crowd. BESS and the DUKE s together off to the side. They clap and smile, but the st is evident. GREY, unseen near the doorway, watches GEORGIANA taking i the APPLAUSE. Finally, the applause dies.  101

dialogues.speaker: FOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you, all of you, for this reception today. GEORGIANA sees GREY on the sidelines. She glances at the DUKE then turns to slip away. GREY sees this. He follows.

dialogues.speaker: FOX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We have won the vote, and now we must win the future! APPLAUSE as GREY exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA heads for her coach, well away from the crowd. GREY catches up with her.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: We did it. Or should I say you did it. GEORGIANA tries to smile, but she can't. She turns away f GREY. He knows something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Georgiana?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (the hardest thing to say) Mr. Grey... I have enjoyed more than I can say the times we've spent together, the talks... GEORGIANA is overcome. She almost breaks down. GREY looks in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I cannot say what -

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Now! GEORGIANA looks at him. She has to do this as she planned

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: ...I have been unfair to you.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be composed) ...I have...indulged in your affections and made it seem my feelings towards you were more than they are in fact. I fear the heat of the election...

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Say what you mean!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (looks dead at him) You love me.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I do not love you. GREY takes this punch, but his eyes never blink, never wa

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You are not speaking what is in your heart.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: It is - GREY suddenly stands and strides away, pacing, angry.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: (cuts her off) This is a speech, forced upon you-

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (overlaps below) No. It's what I've always known to be true!

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: (overlaps above) -- by those who would destroy our happiness!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (loud, in the clear)

dialogues.speaker: THIS IS HOW I AM
dialogues.text: GREY is taken aback by her force and volume.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was wrong to offer you hope. I was wrong to pretend an affection I do not feel. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have said it yourself, I need to be adored. That is my weakness. GREY looks sick. He turns from her, angry, hurt, unable t find a place to put his feelings. GEORGIANA fights back the tears. We hear CHEERS o.s. GREY turns to her and bows before heading back across the gras the stage. We can hear FOX still speaking.

dialogues.speaker: FOX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We have followed our ideas and our ideals, and in the struggle, we have found ourselves! CLOSE ON GEORGIANA as the colour drains from her face. Sh is dying inside but she keeps it all in. She calmly turns and walks to her carriage and is driven away into the bus London street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ELECTION NIGHT PARTY. Music plays in the background. The DUKE waits at the top of the GRAND STAIRCASE, greetin GUESTS. He's dressed for the evening. BESS is with him, also dressed. After a few moments, GEORGIANA appears, walking towards u down the long corridor that leads into the entrance hall. When she reaches the light we see she is dressed to the nines and powdered a deathly white, and has been drinking heavily. The DUKE refuses to register her, but BESS looks across, shocked. GEORGIANA will not meet her eyes, however and walks through into the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rooms have been converted into gaming areas for the evening. It is boisterous and smoky. There are card table and players everywhere. GEORGIANA, wanders through, takin another drink from a passing WAITER. As GEORGIANA goes we pick up details of this decadent society.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where before it may have seemed glamorous and exciting it now looks uglier and sordid: a place of corruption and addiction, on the edge of collapse. GEORGIANA downs her drink. She passes: gambling at a tabl two fat old men taking snuff; a man in a lewd embrace wit a drunk woman; another man toadying to an important politician. The DUKE appears and looks on, concerned. GEORGIANA takes another drink and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. BALLROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA comes into the dancing area alone. The DUKE and BESS are with a group nearby. GEORGIANA seems to radiate force field that keeps people away from her. But not FOX.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: You promised me a dance. Come. Give me my small pleasures. GEORGIANA yields to her old friend. Amid the rest of the GUESTS, GEORGIANA dances around and around with FOX. Her face is hardened, distant - a vision of suppressed anger, frustration and pain. She closes her eyes, her mind drifting to thoughts of GREY. GEORGIANA grabs another drink as they pass a SERVANT. She bumps into SHERIDAN. Drink goes on his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN
dialogues.text: My dear Duchess, much as I know you love dancing and drinking, I really must advise you to settle for one or the other, for the two are incompatible in the long run.  105

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (very drunk) Why, Sheridan, you never were such a spoilsport before! GEORGIANA does a turn and slips. FOX steadies her. She smiles an apology. Then... Suddenly GEORGIANA stumbles. Her WIG falls against a CAND and GOES UP IN FLAMES. DANCERS back away. BESS looks shocked. GEORGIANA SCREAMS as she staggers, hair on fire. DOORS OPEN, SHOUTS, SERVANTS rush about. BESS attempts to knock the WIG off GEORGIANA's head. The DUKE appears in his doorway, none too pleased. He sees th situation. He turns to a FOOTMAN, all efficiency.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Please put out Her Grace's hair. The FOOTMAN splashes water on the wig. HISS and SMOKE. The DUKE looks down at GEORGIANA: she lies sprawled on th polished parquet floor: wig-less, her make-up smeared, he eyes red and glassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a SMALL BOWL with a WHITE HANDKERCHIEF draped ov the top. There are DROPS OF BLOOD on the handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEVILLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Her Grace needs to rest. We see GEORGIANA in bed, pale, washed out, and exhausted. BESS, the DUKE, and MAIDS hover as DR. NEVILLE (62) sets bowl aside.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEVILLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As long as you follow strict instructions, there should be no impediment to the birth. The DUKE is mystified. BESS looks at GEORGIANA, who shows sign of registering what has been said.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEVILLE
dialogues.text: The Duchess is pregnant.  106 107 108 109 The DUKE and BESS react. GEORGIANA has no reaction at all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A church stands out against the countryside. There are so of distant bells far off in the distance. A BOY runs into bell tower and rings the bell as hard as he can... In another church in another part of the county, another BOY hears the sound and rings his own the church’s bells. And in another church, bells ring out too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - A NAKED NEWBORN BABY being washed by a NURSE. is a boy. In the background the bells continue to ring. I the room are DR. NEVILLE, and MAIDS.

dialogues.speaker: DR. NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Your Grace. DR NEVILLE bows and makes his way out of the room. As he goes a SERVANT appears.

dialogues.speaker: SERVANT
dialogues.text: His Grace wishes to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DUKE is seated at his desk, a contract out in front o him. HEATON stands and points out where he should sign.

dialogues.speaker: HEATON
dialogues.text: Also there Your Grace...And there... HEATON offers a smile. The DUKE says nothing. He senses GEORGIANA, who is at the library door looking in.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Come. GEORGIANA enters. The DUKE looks to HEATON.  110

dialogues.speaker: HEATON
dialogues.text: Your Grace. As per the terms of His Grace’s inheritance, this is for you. To spend as you wish. HEATON hands her a cheque. GEORGIANA looks at the DUKE wi disdain.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (very sad and dry) Success at last. The DUKE looks away, ashamed. GEORGIANA turns to the door

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I too abhor this whole thing. GEORGIANA turns back. The DUKE is now standing.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yet remove our traditions - separate our estates, sell off the land and the nobility simply ceases to be. Without us England would once again suffer absolute monarchy or descend into absolute anarchy. I don’t wish to see that happen. Do you? GEORGIANA looks at him, then turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BABY BOY lies in a moving pram. GEORGIANA walks with children. She holds CHARLOTTE by the hand, while LITTLE G and HARRYO look into a pram pushed by a NANNY.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE G
dialogues.text: He's so small.

dialogues.speaker: HARRYO
dialogues.text: You've been that small yourself.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE G
dialogues.text: Not that small. Have I, Mama?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: You have, darling. You've all been that small once.

dialogues.speaker: HARRYO
dialogues.text: See, I told you.  They continue towards the old FARM HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: HARRYO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can't tell that he's a boy at all.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: But he is.

dialogues.speaker: HARRYO
dialogues.text: But if I can't tell, I fail to see why it's so important. He looks just like the rest of us. GEORGIANA smiles at his innocent view of the world.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: All babies look alike when they have their clothes on, but each of them is something quite unique.

dialogues.speaker: HARRYO
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: You and Little G did not look at all like one another. You cried all the time when you were a baby, whereas Little G was quiet as a mouse. She could walk before you, but you could talk before her. The children listen. Charlotte looks at GEORGIANA.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLOTTE
dialogues.text: What about me, Mama?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: You never cried, darling. You were always so brave. They have reached the cascade by the side of the house. T children instinctively run in and start playing in the wa GEORGIANA turns to look down the hill. She should be happ She isn't. Then she seems to see someone. HER POV -- A MA coming across the GREEN. As he gets closer she realises w it is: GREY.

dialogues.speaker: A LITTLE LATER
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA waits for GREY. He takes off his hat and bows. It’s awkward, stiff.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Your Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods ) Mister Grey. Are you recalled from France?

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: For a while.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: No revolution yet?

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: No, not yet. But it’s only a matter of time. They look at each other. A long beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I bore a son. GREY realizes she is making a point.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: His name is William George Spencer Cavendish, Marquis of Hartington. We shall call him Hart.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You and the Duke must be very pleased.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: We are. He has gone to London to celebrate. Beat. GREY gazes at her. They're both full of longing.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have been missed...much missed...How is it that you are here?

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I received an invitation. I assumed it was on behalf of the party; I could not say no. GEORGIANA is confused, but covers it up.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Yes, of course. Come inside.  111 112 113 114

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP of fingers playing strings on a harp. The camera tracks back to reveal a HARPIST next to a STRING QUARTET. The music carries through this scene and the next... The GUESTS play cards. GEORGIANA and SHERIDAN are on one table, BESS, GREY and FOX on the other. The atmosphere is tense. GEORGIANA can’t help glancing from her table to GREY at his. GREY can’t help glancing back.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN
dialogues.text: Down six hundred. G. Yours?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (distracted) Yes, of course. I will match you.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN
dialogues.text: You'll need cards, of course. GEORGIANA realizes SHERIDAN hasn't dealt yet.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I am too tired to play. (Nodding to the players) Gentlemen. GEORGIANA gets up and leaves the room. Just outside BESS comes up to her. There is silence and suspicion from GEORGIANA. She tries to continue walking.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: No one must know. GEORGIANA stares at BESS. What...? And then she realizes.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: You summoned Grey.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: Good night, G.  GEORGIANA makes her way across the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREY is sitting by the fire. The door opens. GEORGIANA enters. GREY stands up, yet keeps his distance.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Your Grace... Beat. They look at each other. GEORGIANA walks forward an kisses him. GREY kisses her back, but after a moment pull away. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Firmly) I was ready to give you everything...how can I believe it won't happen again? GEORGIANA approaches again.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I give you my promise... GREY looks into her eyes, caught between his head and his heart. GEORGIANA starts to undress him, confidently, seductively until he is naked. GEORGIANA pushes GREY gently back onto the bed. Then she hitches up her skirts and straddles him, her dress enveloping the lower half of his body. Underneath, his hands reach inside to touch her. They begin making love. It's as if it's the first time fo both of them: real, intimate and convincing, an extraordinary release...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The window is open and wind blows gently in. Night birds call in the background. GEORGIANA and GREY lie in each other's arms. They kiss, long and tender. GREY pulls away

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: (Gently) You should return to your room.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: No I should not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few days later. GEORGIANA, BESS, and the DUKE eat. GEORGIANA is nervous. She hesitates, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to Bath.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (looks up) But I can't get away for weeks.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (trying to seem natural) I shall go without you. (To Bess) Bess, you stay and keep our husband company, whilst I take the cure. The DUKE looks decidedly undecided. GEORGIANA looks to BE for help. She’s not sure it’s a good idea but acquiesces.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: Yes, William, why not? If G goes now we can catch her up when you're free. GEORGIANA looks at BESS, thankful for the help. She tries to remain looking casual. The DUKE relents.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Well, if you must.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RENTED BATH HOUSE. EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: Birdsong

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s morning. GREY and GEORGIANA are in bed surrounded by newspapers and cartoons. They are looking at cartoons and laughing at them.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Which one is your favourite? This one?

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: (seriously at first) Well, in this one you are proud and strong, which is very good.... In this one you are fair and gentle... and in this one you seem to have only one eyebrow!  GEORGIANA laughs, trying to snatch the image out of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (giving him a playful nudge) Oh, you politicians know nothing of fashion. They laugh and continue:

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: But wait, wait... if you were to ask me which is my favourite... (leaning in and taking her face in his hands) it’s this one - my Duchess. The G no one else ever gets to see. They lock eyes, clearly in love, and kiss passionately.  120 121

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLITICAL PEOPLE are filing into a building for a meeting GREY and GEORGIANA are in an isolated alley, adjacent to the building, standing close, obviously in love.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Will you be long?

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Until late I fear. It seems politics is divided into those who want to fix things and those that merely want to talk about fixing things. GEORGIANA smiles. GREY smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting for you... She touches his arm gently and looks into his eyes. For a beat too long. Then GREY goes inside. ANGLE - THE END OF THE ALLEY: PEOPLE have spotted them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA is in bed, naked and asleep. GREY is awake. He stares at her. Something is troubling him. She wakes, see his concern.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: ...What’s the matter? There is no reply.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Charles?

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: The matter is that in a few days I will have to leave. You will be back with your husband, and I won't be with you. GREY gets out of bed and walks to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it would be better if I were married too, then we could be a triangle or a quadrangle, or... whatever angle could contain you and me and-- I should ask Lady Bess; she seems to have surveyed the geometry and bent it to her favour. GEORGIANA gets out of bed and tries to comfort him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Charles, we've had this time all for ourselves. Let’s not taint it with thoughts of anything else...Anyway, whatever will become of us when you're made Prime Minister? GREY laughs.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you are, you'll be very far from me then.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: (Very intense) Never. GEORGIANA embraces him. GREY holds her tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contented and happy Grey walks into the political meeting rooms.  122 123

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA is standing in her bedroom, a made bed behind her. A MAID puts the finishing touch to her hair and clothes. GEORGIANA walks out into the ante room, heading for the foyer. The double doors open in front of her... ...to reveal the DUKE and LADY SPENCER waiting for her. T are in travelling clothes. GEORGIANA gasps.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Thought we would surprise you. I think you once said there wasn't enough spontaneity in our marriage. Or words to that affect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, what are you doing here? LADY SPENCER sends her a severe look.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: So. Have you seen many of our circle down here?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Some. The Cokes. And Haverford. And Lord Wicklow.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Bunch of politicos, too, aren't there? Meetings and such.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I believe.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Isn't... isn't Grey here? A beat as GEORGIANA's heart stops.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By which I mean Mr Charles Grey. Rumour has it that he is. GEORGIANA jumps to the heart of the issue.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I won't give him up.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: Georgiana!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Everyone has a lover. Bess is the lover of my husband!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: That situation was agreed upon.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Yes, I held myself in so little esteem that I acquiesced to make you happy!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: If you had exercised some discretion, it may have been different.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Differ--?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only good fortune is that it hasn't yet made it to the newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: My dear, Grey is unmarried. He has no rank and no wealth. He risks nothing with this affair. The hazard is all yours.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Grey loves me.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: So does your husband. GEORGIANA stares at her mother in disbelief, then at the DUKE.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Yes. I love you!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: In the way I understand love.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: Georgiana, this has gone much too far. It is beneath our dignity. All London is talking...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Then let them talk! Grey makes me a fallen woman, well and good, now William may divorce me and Bess becomes Duchess of Devonshire!

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: That will never happen! LADY SPENCER stares harshly at GEORGIANA. Then she makes the door.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think I will leave you to it. LADY SPENCER leaves the room. GEORGIANA looks apprehensiv at the DUKE.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: What follows now? Are you going to tear off my clothes and force yourself upon me again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why on earth would I do that? GEORGIANA looks at him in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know that you've not thought much of either my intellect or my Manners, but in fact I never do anything that serves no purpose. GEORGIANA is hurt, and looks at the DUKE in silence. He i composed in a way she has never seen before.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know precisely what you two have together.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: We love each other.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I do not doubt it. He is a dreamer like yourself. You both dream of another world that does not exist and never will. (Beat) As for reality, however, allow me to enlighten you: If you do not give him up at once, I will see to it that every home and cheque book in this country is closed to him. He will be welcome neither in the halls of government nor its back rooms of power. His dream of becoming prime minister, your mutual fantasy of a changed world, will be dead as ash. The DUKE pauses before delivering the final blow.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you will never see your children again. GEORGIANA is open mouthed, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are given to say "love is an act." Well, this is an act. GEORGIANA turns and runs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA is close to the wall, trembling. LADY SPENCER enters and shuts the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: What do you imagine you will have if you stay with Grey?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Love. Passion.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: For a time.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: For ever.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: There is no such thing.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Mama...all my life, it seems to me, I've been fighting my way upstream. With Charles, I find myself going down the stream, effortlessly and naturally. I never realized that it could be that easy. You can't ask me to battle nature, and my own heart. Not now.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: Oh will you never grow up! And how will you live, even? Friends will shun you, family will abandon you. There won't be a house open to you in all of England.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (trying to convince herself) Grey will be Prime Minister.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: Not with his whore, the Duchess of "D" on his arm and the Duke pulling every string to ruin him. He will never be Prime Minister. He'll pretend it doesn't matter, but it will. He'll put on a good face for a while, but he'll come to hate you for it. At this GEORGIANA's eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most likely you’1l end up alone - a wife with no husband and a mother with no children. At best you'll become someone else’s mistress, living on charity, which can be taken away at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: You can’t know all that!

dialogues.speaker: LADY SPENCER
dialogues.text: Look at your friend Bess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DUKE waits by the front door. GEORGIANA exits the dressing room and walks toward him. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I must ask you to return to London.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Without you?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Yes. The DUKE takes out a PACKAGE OF LETTERS.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: These are from the girls - I promised to deliver them. Hart neglected to write, but then he is not yet one. The DUKE puts the PACKAGE in her hand. GEORGIANA takes th but holds them down by her side, refusing to even acknowledge them.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I cannot give up Charles. I could not survive another day without him.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Then I must warn you. This will be the mistake of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I made that many years ago. I trust you can let yourself out. GEORGIANA leaves. The DUKE sends her an icy stare, then t to the SERVANT at the door.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: For God's sake, open the door, man! The servant quickly opens the door. The DUKE exits. LADY SPENCER follows from the ANTE ROOM. At the door she share one last sad look with GEORGIANA, then walks past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREY is pacing up and down. GEORGIANA remains standing. a

dialogues.speaker: GREY KK
dialogues.text: No. We would be foolish to let ake future fears stand in our way. KKK

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA KK
dialogues.text: He will be without mercy. aK

dialogues.text: We'll fight... we

dialogues.text: What do we have to fight with? KKK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our ideals, our principles. And if we must we will make sacrifices.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: And are you ready to do that? Everything you’ve worked for? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Yes, I am...whatever is necessary. If it means we will be together. GEORGIANA looks at him, trying to gauge in her own mind o she believes this. Before she is able to probe further...

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you? Beat, as GEORGIANA considers the full consequences of thi

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Yes. Beat. GREY smiles and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Let us talk later. I shall be back soon. GEORGIANA looks at him as he leaves. GREY turns in the doorway and smiles. She smiles back at him but there is doubt creeping in behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA enters the room, strong and confident. A SERVAN takes her cape and hat then leaves. GEORGIANA is alone. S is aware of the package of CHILDREN’S LETTERS on the side table where the DUKE left it. GEORGIANA turns away from it but after a moment turns bac She takes a deep breath and rips it open. There are LETTE in spidery children’s handwriting, colourful drawings. It hits her hard. She fingers trace over the drawings, the messages, the kisses at the bottom.... She is suddenly faced with the reality of the choice she about to make. It’s heart breaking but she knows she can’ be without her children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA rushes into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA runs into the room and hugs her children. Minutes later: we are behind the DUKE as he walks slowly down a corridor. We can hear children’s voices in the background. He reaches the end of the corridor and the scene is revealed: GEORGIANA sits in the middle of the room, surrounded by her children, playing a game together GEORGIANA hugs the girls. Closer. Tighter. In the background, GEORGIANA notices the DUKE surveying t scene. GEORGIANA gestures to the NANNY to come over.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Run along, girls. I shall join you in a moment. The GIRLS leave with the NANNY. The DUKE watches them go, then turns to GEORGIANA.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You must know that I am greatly pleased that we have come to an arrangement. It's not good for little ones to be without their mother for too long.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: My life for theirs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one way of putting it. Your mother called it "common decency before personal gratification", or some such thing... the exact words escape me...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: How about ‘imprisoned in my own house’?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: No, that's not how she put it. I would have remembered that. GEORGIANA sends him a hateful look and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA walks into the corridor. After a few moments sh sees BESS appear from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: (Whisper) How did Charles take it? GEORGIANA stops by her. She is businesslike.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I just left. If I had seen him again, I would have stayed.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: No letter, either? GEORGIANA shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: BESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know it's cruel, Georgiana, but it’s for the best. GEORGIANA looks at BESS, then continues to walk off down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. DINING ROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A VIOLINIST and HARPSICHORDIST play a beautiful, slow pie of music from the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music continues in the background as three silver plates covered by silver domes are carried by SERVANTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA, BESS and the DUKE are seated for dinner at the vast table. It’s tense, silent and extremely formal as th THREE SERVANTS bring in the plates. In unison they step forward to take away the domes, revealing elaborately prepared POUSSIN - it’s an unexpected comic moment. They begin to eat. No one says a word. Suddenly we hear DOORS CRASH OPEN from far outside the room. There is the distant sound of a man’s voice, raised and angry. GEORGIA knows immediately that it is GREY. So too does the DUKE w shoots her a vicious look. GEORGIANA rises,

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Your Grace, Bess. Will you excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. ENTRANCE HALL. NIGHT
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA enters to see GREY at the foot of the stairs, surrounded by FOOTMEN trying to stop him get further. GRE is wild. He yells at GEORGIANA, quite oblivious to the FOOTMEN.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Why haven't you responded to my letters?! GEORGIANA tries to maintain calm and walks toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have written a dozen times a day, and there is nothing from you! What has happened?! Do you love me no longer?! She looks at the FOOTMEN, headed by BURLEIGH, the butler.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Burleigh. BURLEIGH bows, and though still remaining present, recede into the background with the FOOTMEN. GREY comes closer. GEORGIANA steels herself...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My personal feelings remain unaltered...

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Then we must be together again. I want to marry you. I want you to bear my children ... and I don't care if they are boys or girls! ...But GEORGIANA is barely holding it together.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I wish it could be like that.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: It can. It will. Sorrows come however we try to avoid them. We must stay our course and not give in.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (Firmly) No, Charles. GREY steps forward to take her arm but GEORGIANA backs away. BURLEIGH makes as if to intervene, but holds back.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You must leave and be with me, a free woman! Now, let us leave now! It is still possible. Let us at least take a chance.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I cannot risk my children. GREY stares at her with wide, angry, tortured eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a sacrifice I am forced to make...but I have given you up for them only. And in so doing I have lost my heart and soul. GREY looks at her, sad and weak, nothing left to argue. GEORGIANA stands firm. She gestures to BURLEIGH.  139 140

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Burleigh, will you please escort Mr. Grey to the door? BURLEIGH comes forward and stands next to GREY. GEORGIANA still looks at him. Her eyes glisten.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You promised me.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I know... GREY, choking with pain, stares one more beat, then turns and walks away. BURLEIGH and FOOTMEN follow, like bouncer

dialogues.speaker: INT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. DINING ROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA slowly sits again. She is distant, with no interest in the food in front of her. The DUKE looks up, chewing.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: What’s the matter, don’t like the chicken? I find it really quite decent. The table is quiet. Not even BESS can muster a reply. GEORGIANA looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I’m with child.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. GEORGIANA’S BEDROOM - MORNING 140 Rain spits against the window. Wind blows in the trees outside. GEORGIANA is sitting in her bed, staring blankly before her. The DUKE and BESS enter.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (to Bess) Will you be so kind as to inform the Duchess of my decision? BESS looks deeply uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: (appealingly) Georgiana - GEORGIANA does not respond, but keeps staring into the a BESS takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be like this: you will be taken to the country where you will give birth to the child, and the child will subsequently be trusted to the care of Charles Grey's family. GEORGIANA makes no reply.

dialogues.speaker: BESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you listening to me? GEORGIANA slides silently into a reclining position.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I think she has heard you. Let's leave her.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: Georgiana, please -—

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I said: let's leave. This is not a discussion. She has been informed of my decision. BESS looks at GEORGIANA.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: Have pity on her, William...

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Pity be damned. She brought this upon herself, as well you know. Now come... The DUKE starts to go out. BESS’s voice stops him.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: No. I will go with her.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere...

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: (Turns, magnificently) I will go with G if G will have me, and there is nothing you can say or do to stop either of us. The DUKE is speechless. GEORGIANA looks up for the first time. The DUKE leaves. The women are left alone in silenc with each other. Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a windy, end of summer day, TWO PLAIN COACHES travel across the flat and largely featureless landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is simple and remote, the only building for mil around. Chickens peck outside. It is far removed from the opulence GEORGIANA and BESS are used to. The two COACHES are parked outside. From the rear COACH, luggage is being unpacked and brought inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA enters this house with BESS and a SERVANT. It’s plain and unlived in. BESS follows GEORGIANA into what is to be her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: I couldn't not be with you. GEORGIANA smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I count it a triumph we have become friends again when fate has been so intent on keeping us rivals.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: So do I. The Duke is for my boys only. You are for me. GEORGIANA puts her hands around her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Bess, how will I do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Charlotte, for Harryo, for little G, for Hart... GEORGIANA nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HOUSE IN THE COUNTRYSIDE. DAY
dialogues.text: We hear the muted sounds of GEORGIANA screaming over shot of the house and the wildlife around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baby is sleeping in its cot.  149 BESS is sitting in the other corner of the room. A FOOTMA appears at the door and nods to her. BESS looks apprehensive. She goes to GEORGIANA’s bedside.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: (Gently) It’s time. GEORGIANA flinches - it’s the moment she’s been dreading. BESS comes closer and gestures toward the BABY.

dialogues.speaker: BESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would it help if I...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: (Looking up) No, Bess. I must do it. GEORGIANA snips a piece of hair from her sleeping baby an puts it in a distinctive silver locket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a barren and featureless landscape with one straigh dirt track running through it. TWO DARK COACHES are alrea parked ahead. GEORGIANA’s COACH, containing GEORGIANA and BESS, pulls up fifty yards behind it. At the first of the DARK COACHES, a BUTLER stands to one side, a WET NURSE to the other. From the second steps a serious looking older man, GENERAL GREY. CHARLES GREY is nowhere to be seen. BESS looks on from the side of their COACH as GEORGIANA slowly takes the BABY up the track, holding it tight to h all the way.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GREY
dialogues.text: (Flatly) Your Grace. I am General Grey.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Where is Charles?

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GREY
dialogues.text: Your husband thought it best if I took care of this. GEORGIANA takes a deep breath. She hadn’t expected this, and now she is being asked to hand her baby over to a stranger, and a seemingly cold one at that. It’s not clea that she will go through with it... GEORGIANA gently kisses the baby’s head, whispering to h smelling her hair, her skin, running her nose down her fa and breathing her in for one last time. BESS finds this impossible to watch and turns away.  150 With immense difficulty GEORGIANA finally goes to hand he baby over. GENERAL GREY does not take it. He nods sharply to his WET NURSE who steps forward to take the BABY, although for a moment GEORGIANA simply can’t let her go. GENERAL GREY immediately turns to go back to the COACH. GEORGIANA calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: General Grey... GENERAL GREY stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -.-her name is Eliza. GENERAL GREY looks at GEORGIANA giving nothing away. He turns and goes back into his COACH, followed by the BUTLE and the WET NURSE and GEORGIANA’S BABY GIRL into theirs. As the BABY GIRL is passed into the coach, GEORGIANA can hear her daughter begin to cry a little. GEORGIANA instinctively flinches, using all her strength to hold he back from running over to comfort her. The driver cracks the whip and GEORGIANA watches as the DARK COACHES ride off, leaving her alone with the barren landscape behind. She slowly sinks down onto the wet and muddy ground. BESS comes forward and holds her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cot is empty. Low winter sun cuts through the windows GEORGIANA sits alone in her bedroom, lost in thought and rolling a locket of Eliza’s hair back and forth between h fingers. It feels as if she has been sat there all night. BESS enters and comes close. It takes a moment for GEORGIANA to notice she’s even there. BESS produces two linen FLANNELS. GEORGIANA looks quizzically at them.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: (Gently) For your milk. GEORGIANA looks down - there are two wet patches on her breasts. BESS kneels next to GEORGIANA and holds tight on GEORGIANA’s almost lifeless body.

dialogues.speaker: BESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Duke has asked that we return as soon as possible. GEORGIANA nods but doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. GARDEN. AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: A primitive sprinkler is operated by a GARDENER spreading water across the manicured green grass making a loud and distinctive sound. Other GARDENERS are on their hands and knees cutting the grass with scissors. Time has elapsed, perhaps a month, and it’s spring now. Inside, there are a series of shots of the empty, still house.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. ROOM. AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA sits in a chair, distracted. She clutches the silver locket of Eliza's hair, the chain wrapped tight around her hand. A MAID appears at the door. GEORGIANA’s clutches the lock in her hand so it can’t be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Grace, I have Charlotte to see you. GEORGIANA turns her head to the door. CHARLOTTE is standi with the MAID. She steps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLOTTE
dialogues.text: We are all in the garden, Mama. Will you come and join us? GEORGIANA is unable to connect for a split second. CHARLOTTE remains looking at her. GEORGIANA comes to and about to say yes but sees the DUKE approaching from behin

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: In a moment. CHARLOTTE gives a small smile and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Hello, G.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Your Grace. The DUKE fidgets and, unusually for him, looks warmly at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not particularly adept at expressing myself when it comes to matters of a more personal nature, but I shall endeavour to try. [Beat] Over the years I have acted in ways that you have judged... harsh. Well I do not wish for you to undergo any further suffering. Indeed, I would like our life to return to a calm normality.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Thank you William. The DUKE looks relieved. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Lady Melbourne has arranged a small gathering in honour of your recent return from holiday. Given some of the vague reports that have been circulating over this past year, I think it would be wise for us to go. A show of unity, so to speak. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Who will be there?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Everybody. GEORGIANA recognises what this must mean.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: As you wish. The DUKE turns back to the window. We see what he sees: BESS is playing with all their children in the garden, th image distorted by the wavy glass of the window pane. It a mirrored moment from his opening scene where he watched the young people dancing, his thoughts then a mystery... The DUKE resumes his faraway look and says as if from nowhere,

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: How wonderful to be that free. GEORGIANA looks at him sympathetically, as if for the fir time she finally understands this trapped and complex man  153b The DUKE, a little exposed by his revealing statement, no and leaves, disappearing off into the long corridor. After a beat, GEORGIANA takes the DUKE’s position at the window and looks out at the children playing with BESS an smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. DEVONSHIRE HOUSE. GARDEN. DAY 153b BESS stands in the garden, watching the children. GEORGIA approaches from behind her. The two women look at each other, understanding the sentiment completely. They smile, then GEORGIANA leads th forward to the children. They turn to see her.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Who will catch me first? The children’s faces light up. GEORGIANA runs around the garden, chased by them and BESS until she finally allows herself to be caught.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. LADY MELBOURNE'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: A society gathering is in full swing. A FOOTMAN addresses the party in his booming voice.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTMAN
dialogues.text: The Duke and Duchess of Devonshire. And Lady Elizabeth Foster. Behind the front doors BESS whispers to GEORGIANA.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: Are you ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Yes. The room goes quiet with a great sense of expectation... The doors swing open... GEORGIANA steps back into the limelight... She's looks stylish but in a mature, demure way. GEORGIANA walks through the crowd, taking in the scene around her. She nods hello to FOX and SHERIDAN, and there a warm, ad-hoc mix of bowing and ‘welcome home Your Grace She has been accepted back with respect and relief.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 155A
dialogues.text: INT. LADY MELBOURNE’S HOUSE. ROOM - NIGHT 155B GEORGIANA enters another room full of people. Across it s sees CHARLES GREY. The DUKE and BESS are aware of him too but stand back to allow GEORGIANA to handle the situation It feels risky in this company but GEORGIANA walks throug the crowd toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Grey.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Your Grace... A subtle hush descends on the gathering as the GUESTS around them look over with bated breath, sensing the whif of scandal. The tension in the room is palpable. GEORGIANA’s is nervous and it is unclear whether she will give way to her emotions or manage to keep her composure. GREY too, is awkward but summons up the strength to act f the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I trust your tour was agreeable? GEORGIANA understands what he is doing and reciprocates.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you. We passed the summer in Switzerland and the winter in Nice.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Well, I speak for everybody when I say how glad I am that you have returned home safely. GEORGIANA smiles back. Her eyes tell a different story. T polite and seemingly innocent small talk continues...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: And what news is there with you? GREY looks uncomfortable. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I am to be engaged to Lady Ponsonby. The announcement will follow shortly. GEORGIANA swallows hard. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Congratulations. Beat. GREY looks at her again.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: And I have a niece... GEORGIANA looks up quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +..-who is much loved. Beat as she takes a moment to digest this..

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One day you should come and see her. In a little while. If you would like... Beat. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: I would like that very much.  156 157 GEORGIANA curtsies with perfect etiquette and walks back into the party. GREY watches her go as she walks confidently off into the crowd to join the DUKE and BESS who are waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: It’s still and silent in the house.

dialogues.speaker: DEVONSHIRE HOUSE
dialogues.text: The DUKE, BESS and GEORGIANA walk through a long corridor They stop at the point in the corridor where it splits in two directions: one toward the DUKE’s bedroom, the other toward GEORGIANA and BESS’s.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Good night, G.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIANA
dialogues.text: Good night, William. The DUKE turns to BESS, expecting her to follow him. BESS looks to GEORGIANA, who looks back intensely. BESS gets t message and turns back to the DUKE.

dialogues.speaker: BESS
dialogues.text: Good night, William. The DUKE is surprised, but doesn’t want to upset the newfound harmony.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Oh yes, well...Good night Bess. The DUKE walks off to his bedroom alone. GEORGIANA and BE walk together, two massive dresses side by side down the middle of the wide corridors and rooms, rustling in the silence. They look at each other and smile supportively, then reach out to hold hands.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: (FORMERLY PART OF SC. 157) INT. GEORGIANA’S BEDROOM. 160

dialogues.speaker: DEVONSHIRE HOUSE
dialogues.text: GEORGIANA and BESS settle outside GEORGIANA’s bedroom. GEORGIANA looks at BESS. BESS smiles back. They embrace a BESS walks off. In a mirror of scene 4AB GEORGIANA walks from camera int the room, then turns around for us to see her strong, determined face. GEORGIANA nods to two servants who step forward, take the handles and pull the double doors close GEORGIANA’s face finally disappearing behind the crack in the middle with a bang. Cut to black. After a moment the following words appear: Georgiana, the Duke and Bess lived openly together for th next ten years until Georgiana died Fade out / fade in: Georgiana ensured in her will that Bess could marry the Duke and become the next Duchess of Devonshire Fade out / fade in Grey became Britain’s 32nd Prime Minister Fade to black, then fade up to: A PORTRAIT OF ELIZA - her face a mix between GEORGIANA an GREY. On this is superimposed: In late childhood Eliza found out the true identity of he mother. The source of the informant remains unknown. The picture pans down to a miniature around ELIZA’s neck it is of GEORGIANA as she started in the film: an open, optimistic seventeen year old girl smiling out to camera. End titles.
